item.title: ADIA 支持的印度基金将寻求 40 亿美元用于基础设施建设
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在政府推动全国基础设施升级的背景下，印度的准主权基金计划在其有史以来规模最大的一次筹资中筹集约 40 亿美元。【原文：India’s quasi-sovereign fund plans to seek about $4 billion in its largest-ever fundraise, according to people with knowledge of the matter, amid the government’s drive to upgrade infrastructure across the country.】

item.title: 德国作为汽车大国的形象因大众汽车的缓慢下滑而受到冲击
item.description:
汽车制造商发出可能关闭工厂的警告，是欧洲第一大经济体制造业衰落的最具象征意义的时刻。【原文：

The carmaker’s warning of possible factory closures is the most symbolic moment yet for the decline of manufacturing in Europe’s No. 1 economy.

】

item.title: 为收益率曲线欢呼？没那么快
item.description:
这可能意味着我们正处于经济衰退的边缘。但周五合适的就业报告可能会扭转市场最近的颓势。【原文：

It could imply we’re on the cusp of recession. But the right jobs report Friday might turn around the latest market slide.

】

item.title: 尼日利亚燃料价格上涨，奈拉疲软，暂停加息呼声高涨
item.description: 汽油零售价上涨 45% 以及奈拉持续承受的下行压力抑制了尼日利亚中央银行在本月会议上暂停加息的希望。【原文：A 45% hike in the pump price of gasoline and a continued downward pressure on the naira dampened hopes that the Central Bank of Nigeria will press pause on an interest-rate increase at a meeting this month.】

item.title: 布洛克称，如果 CPI 居高不下，澳大利亚央行将难以实现就业目标
item.description: 澳大利亚央行行长米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）表示，如果通胀率 "无限期 "保持在目标水平之上，那么澳大利亚央行将难以维持低失业率，并警告家庭和企业，利率宽松仍有一段距离。【原文：Australia’s central bank will struggle to maintain low unemployment if inflation stays above its target level “indefinitely,” Governor Michele Bullock said, in a warning to households and firms that interest-rate relief is still some way off.】

item.title: 尽管印度存在禁令和供应问题，但酒类企业销售强劲
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 行业组织警告钢铁行业，铁矿石创 2022 年以来新低
item.description: 铁矿石期货跌至 2022 年以来的最低点，因为在需求疲软的情况下，中国需要努力停止生产大量钢铁。【原文：Iron ore futures sank to their lowest since 2022, as China grapples with the need to stop producing so much steel due while demand is weak.】

item.title: 反贪机构要求提供信息，杨忠礼电力股价下跌
item.description: 杨忠礼电力国际有限公司股价下跌，原因是马来西亚反腐败委员会要求该公司提供有关其下属单位开展的一个政府项目的信息。【原文：YTL Power International Bhd. shares fell as Malaysia’s Anti-Corruption Commission sought information from the company over a government project carried out by its unit.】

item.title: 据说森马将选择摩根大通和摩根士丹利在美国双重上市
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Samsonite International SA 已选择银行帮助安排其在美国的两地上市，以提高流动性并更容易获得全球投资者的青睐。【原文：Samsonite International SA has selected banks to help arrange its dual listing in the US, according to people familiar with the situation, as it seeks to improve liquidity and become more accessible to global investors.】

item.title: 新加坡度假者为十年来最坚挺的美元干杯
item.description: 新加坡元兑美元上一次如此坚挺已经是十多年前的事了，从进出口商到购物者和游客都感受到了这种影响。【原文：It’s been more than a decade since Singapore’s dollar was last this strong against its US counterpart, and the effects are being felt by everyone from importers and exporters to shoppers and tourists.】

item.title: 市场期待美国非农就业数据，黄金在亚洲市场保持稳定
item.description: 黄金走势平稳，本周将公布的美国劳动力数据是市场关注的焦点，因为市场正在寻找美联储即将开始的降息周期会有多激进的线索。【原文：Gold was steady, with US labor data due this week in focus as the market looks for clues on how aggressive the Federal Reserve’s imminent rate-cutting cycle will be.】

item.title: 橡树的马克斯称美联储减息不会将美国利率降至 3% 以下
item.description: 橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management LP）的霍华德-马克斯（Howard Marks）认为，美联储降息后，美国利率将稳定在 3% 至 4% 之间。【原文：US interest rates will settle in a range of between 3% and 4% after reductions by the Federal Reserve, according to Oaktree Capital Management LP’s Howard Marks.】

item.title: 马来西亚债券吸引非套期保值押注，推动林吉特反弹
item.description: 投资者正在抢购马来西亚债券，而无需进行套期保值，这推动了该国货币的涨势，使其成为今年亚洲表现最好的货币。【原文：Investors are snapping up Malaysian bonds without resorting to hedging, supercharging a rally in the country’s currency that’s Asia’s top performer this year.】

item.title: 日元走强拖累出口商，日本股市将下滑
item.description: 日本股市周四可能扩大跌幅，因为日元走强对出口商的盈利前景构成压力，而债券收益率似乎将下降，对银行构成利空。【原文：Japanese stocks are likely to extend losses on Thursday as a stronger yen weighs on the earnings outlook for exporters while bond yields look set to decline in a headwind for banks.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美国就业市场出现裂痕。美元之痛，日元之利。华尔街看衰中国。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. US job market shows some cracks. Dollar’s pain is yen’s gain. Wall Street is souring on China. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 中国财报下滑引发股市反弹新疑虑
item.description: 疲软的财报季使人们对全球第二大经济体消费疲软即将复苏的希望破灭，中国股市正面临更加暗淡的前景。【原文：China’s stock market is facing darker prospects after a weak earnings season dashed hopes for any imminent recovery in flagging consumption that has weighed on the world’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 美国库存有下降迹象，油价在 12 月低点附近震荡
item.description: 由于一份行业报告指出美国原油库存大幅减少，石油市场在本周大幅下挫后得到喘息，在 12 月以来的最低结算价附近企稳。【原文：Oil steadied near the lowest settlement since December as an industry report pointed to a big draw in US crude stockpiles, with the market taking a breather following a sharp selloff this week.】

item.title: Circle K 所有者称正在寻求美国交易，但对七项收购保持沉默；I
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.是一家便利店运营商，曾与 7-Eleven 的母公司洽谈交易事宜。【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc., the convenience store operator that has approached 7-Eleven’s parent company about a deal, said a weaker US economy may improve the prospects for making a large acquisition.】

item.title: 美国就业报告疲软，国债和日元反弹：市场综述
item.description: 周四，在投资者为美联储本月晚些时候降息做准备之际，国债反弹的影响波及整个亚洲市场，削弱了美元，支撑了日元。【原文：The effects of a rally in Treasuries spread across Asian markets Thursday, weakening the dollar and supporting the yen as investors prepared for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts later this month.】

item.title: 摩根大通放弃在美国大选前买入中国股票的建议
item.description: 摩根大通放弃了买入中国股票的建议，理由是除了增长逆风和不温不火的政策支持外，即将到来的美国大选也加剧了波动。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. abandoned its buy recommendation for Chinese stocks, citing heightened volatility around the upcoming US elections in addition to growth headwinds and tepid policy support.】

item.title: 数据提供商道奇建筑公司与贷款人未能达成债务协议
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，道奇建筑网络公司及其贷款人已经结束了关于如何解决公司债务问题的秘密讨论，但未达成协议。【原文：Dodge Construction Network and its lenders have ended confidential discussions on how to tackle the company’s debt without a deal, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 飞利浦 66 首席执行官预计明年全球炼油短缺
item.description: 美国第二大炼油商菲利普斯 66 计划明年的炼油市场将 "具有建设性"，因为燃料制造能力不足，无法满足全球需求。【原文：Phillips 66, the No. 2 US oil refiner, is planning for a “constructive” refining market next year with a shortage of fuel-making capacity available to meet global demand.】

item.title: 阿拉巴马州医院因支出飙升而拖欠 6000 万美元债务
item.description: 阿拉巴马州首府蒙哥马利市一家拥有 344 张床位的医院拖欠了 6000 万美元的市政债券，未能满足债券持有人受托人提出的立即偿还债务的要求。【原文：A 344-bed hospital in Alabama’s capital, Montgomery, defaulted on $60 million of municipal bonds, failing to meet a bondholder trustee’s demand for immediate repayment of the debt.】

item.title: 拜登破灭收购希望，美国钢铁交易传言不攻自破
item.description: 美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp. ）的股价与其日本竞争对手 140 亿美元的收购计划之间的差距急剧扩大，交易员们纷纷抛售股票，因为他们担心该交易会在美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的反对下破裂。【原文：The gap between United States Steel Corp.’s stock price and a $14 billion proposed takeover by its Japanese rival exploded as traders ditched shares amid fears the deal collapse under opposition from President Joe Biden.】

item.title: 利率期权显示美联储本月降息半点的押注上升
item.description: 利率期权交易商加大了赌注，认为美联储将在本月启动宽松周期，降息半个百分点，这反映出人们越来越多地猜测决策者将采取积极行动，以防止经济下滑。【原文：Rate options traders stepped up wagers that the Federal Reserve will kick off its easing cycle with a half-percentage-point cut this month, reflecting the increasing speculation that policymakers will act aggressively to keep the economy from sputtering.】

item.title: 创纪录的债券发行量吸收良好，多数债券趋于紧缩
item.description: 投资者对本周蓝筹股一级债务市场的大量发行表示欢迎，许多在周二创下历史纪录的交易在第二天的交易中已经趋于紧张。【原文：Investors have welcomed an abundance of issuance in the blue-chip primary debt market this week, with many of the deals that debuted on a record-setting Tuesday already trading tighter the next day.】

item.title: 迈阿密圣瑞吉公寓项目获得 5.27 亿美元融资
item.description: 南佛罗里达开发商 Related Group 和 Integra Investments 获得了一笔 5.27 亿美元的贷款，用于在迈阿密建造豪华公寓。【原文：South Florida developers Related Group and Integra Investments landed a $527 million loan to build luxury condos in Miami.】

item.title: 生物技术公司首次公开募股希望渺茫，但已做好上市准备
item.description: 在经历了一连串乏善可陈的交易之后，生物技术行业正期待着四家有望在未来几周内首次定价出售股票的新公司，看看它们能否重振该行业。【原文：After a string of lackluster deals, the biotech industry is looking to four debutants expected to price first-time share sales in the coming weeks to see if they can reignite the sector.】

item.title: 私人信贷公司 HPS 已开始与潜在投资者讨论 IPO 事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，2016 年从摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：HPS Investment Partners, the private credit manager carved out of JPMorgan Chase & Co. in 2016, has begun discussing an initial public offering with potential investors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 布林肯前往海地，安全部队打击黑帮
item.description: 美国国务卿安东尼-布林肯（Antony Blinken）将于本周前往海地，讨论这个饱受暴力蹂躏的加勒比国家的最终政治过渡问题，因为一支国际安全部队正在与肆虐首都太子港的犯罪团伙作斗争。【原文：US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will travel to Haiti this week to discuss an eventual political transition for the violence-plagued Caribbean nation as an international security force is confronting criminal gangs that overran the capital Port-au-Prince.】
